value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. You need to learn how to reference columns, and tables. what operators can be used, and what are the very simple basics of writing a DAX expression. In

value.title: Build Your Own Power BI Audit Log; Usage Metrics Across the Entire Tenant
value.excerpt: Power BI dashboard and reports come with a usage metric, which you can see how users used this content. value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. Let's see how you can use this function.

value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Wr4o5uneFxc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Custom Functions Made Easy in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written a lot about Power Query M scripting language, and how to create custom functions with that. With recent updates of Power BI Desktop, creating custom functions made easier and easier every month. This started with bringing Parameters a few months ago and adding source query for the function

value.title: Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI with NOT IN or NOT EQUAL Rule
value.excerpt: Sometimes when you apply the dynamic row-level security, you want to have the criteria as NOT EQUAL and NOT IN. This can be a bit tricky in the dynamic implementation of RLS because the relationship behavior is normally the opposite. In this video, Iâ€™ll explain how you can do that. Download the file

value.title: Exception Reporting in Power BI Catch the Error Rows in Power Query
value.excerpt: To build a robust BI system, you need to cater for errors and handle errors carefully. If you build a reporting solution that the refresh of that fails everytime an error occurs, it is not a robust system. Errors can happen by many reasons, In this video, Iâ€™ll show you a way to catch potential errors

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX

Read my blog

value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Date dimension or calendar table is one of the most important dimensions in any BI system. In this video, I'm showing you how easy is to create a date dimension using Power Query.
